text: Bottle @ Home, courtesy of Henriksoegaard. Pours clear almost waterlike, just a slight peachcolored note. Aroma of rice, cooked vegetables, alcohol. Flavor is rice, rather sweet, alcohol. Thin body, but still leaving heavy lacing on the glas. 301212
Downed three bottles at Chez Oki, in Brussels. Clear musty body with no head. Nose is rice, of course, sweet and alcy. Taste also sweet and very nice to drink. Warms in the finish. Very enjoyable.

Bottle 720ml. @ [ T.S.H.R.B.G.S.C.S.M.T (The Second Handrup RateBeer Gathering Special Cider Sake Mead Tasting) - Ebeltoft ].Clear crystial clear water colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate rice, almond, alcohol. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, sharp, alcohol, rice, rice boiling water. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is sharp alcoholic. [20120414]
Bottle. Clear colour. Some week almond aroma. Light marcipan/almond flavor. Average finish. Oily palate. not a good sake but still an ok futsu.
Bottle. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almonde and alcohol. Flavour is rice, almonde, meidum sweet with notes of alcohol.
Clear, white, no head. Aroma of fatty rice, sweet and plastics. Moderate to heavy sweet flavor, bad rice, light acidic finish. Syrupy texture. Flat.
Clear as water. Aroma is sweet, cooked rice and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet. Very sweet finish with burning alcohol. Watery. 140412
light sour rice,watery color,light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, light dry finish.
Bottle. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are rice malt, almonds and alcohol.

Bottle from Waitrose. We usually use this for cooking but I have been known to drink it occasionally when the wife isnt home (like now!). Inspired by cgarvieuk, I had this cold and warm. The sake is clear and still. The aroma is of yeast, rice and alcohol. The warmer version seemed to dull down the alcohol and it was a very Marmitey yeast aroma which suits me. Not the most complex sake but it does taste of rice with a lot of Marmite in there, nice lingering flavours and some sweetness. I agree with Craig that this is much better warm. Cold it just feels quite thin and the aromas and flavours dont hit you so much. Not bad but not my favourite either.

bottle at home ... from local chinesse supermarket ... clear ... soft dry rice nose ...thiner tthan my last one ... very ricy ... alcohol present and while not rought rougher than the previuos one ... rough up front but mellower in linger ... this one is melower when warmed... def prfer this warm

Bottle.  Like a white wine., lightly yellow, largely clear.  Aromas are earthy fungi, pepper, alcohol with some vanilla.  Flavours are sweet initially. Then quite dry with lots of pepper.  Mushroom notes.  Alcohol is obvious but clean.  Warming and crisp with some peppery notes.  Better than the one other Sake I have had.  Comforting.

I think this perhaps wasnt in the best condition, perhaps the journey from japan to scotland hadnt done it much good and also it was sitting on the top shelf in blazing lights and heat in a chinese supermarket here. Aroma reminded me of a romanian spirit called swekka, not sure of spelling, off alcoholic plums. Taste was horrendus i forced myself to finish a half glass of this by downing in one, i was nearly sik and had to drink a serious ampount of water afterwards to get rid of the taste, it actually makes me a bit funny thinking about how horrible this stuff was, however in saing that it had a nice mouthfeel so browny points.
